column4: My colleague somehow keeps breaking his way into my computer and elevating his permissions to admin via his user account. How could he be doing this?
in /etc/sudoers?
do you create him/her in the admin group?
nope. I went to administration > users & groups
strange, do you have a root password set?
im not sure...
or do you only use your user account (this is default)
if you arent sure then you havent set it which is good
i suggest you run this just to be sure:   sudo usermod -p '!' root     disables the account
cool
if you run:   groups foo     (replace foo with the username you gave him), is it in the admin group?
does he know your ubuntu password?
sami : sami adm dialout fax cdrom floppy tape dip video plugdev fuse git
looks fine, does he know your ubuntu password?
cos that would do it ;)
possibly he's been packet sniffing
i guess but if you connect to his system then he has the key for that session, it could be done in theory
thats what i thought
install and run rkhunter
it'll need running with sudo
i'd just ask, go the low tech way
ive of coursed ask
i'd disable the account, see if he's actually using his own account
i have done that for now :)
